alert.note: Alert for Absaroka, Beartooth Mountains; Bighorn Canyon; Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Carbon; Northern Rosebud; Northern Stillwater; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Red Lodge Foothills; Southeastern Carbon; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 10:33PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW... At 1028 PM MDT, an band of heavy snow was moving across south central Montana, including portions of I-90, I-94, US-212, US-3 and US-87, moving east to northeast at 30 mph. Locations impacted include... Billings, Hardin, Red Lodge, Hysham, Custer, Laurel, Bridger, Joliet, Fromberg, Melstone, Lockwood, Worden, Fort Smith, Crow Agency, Huntley, Pryor, Shepherd, Billings Heights, Billings West End and Ballantine. A quick one to two inches of snow may accumulate as the band moves through. Winds will gust to 40 mph. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. The heaviest snow will last a half hour to around an hour as the band moves through. Visibilities will briefly fall below one mile in this band of heavy and blowing snow. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations.
